project.name: bsd
project.author: Grant Goodyear
project.description: Providing a BSD system with Gentoo sensibilities.

longdescription.p: An effort to provide a fully-capable BSD operating system with Gentoo design sensibilities. The long-term goal includes allowing users to choose any combination of *BSD or Linux kernels, *BSD or GNU libc, and *BSD or GNU userland tools.
This project is still in its infancy. If you are interested in working on it, please send an e-mail to Stephen Bennett.

project.resource: Tech notes and documentation for Gentoo/*BSD porting.

plannedproject.name: dfly
plannedproject.p: This is a (still unofficial) port of Gentoo under DragonFly BSD system. Quite near to Gentoo/FreeBSD, this port will share many part of the current implementation

plannedproject.name: nbsd
plannedproject.p: This is a (still unofficial) port of Gentoo under NetBSD system. It's currently developed by Damian "thunder" Florczyk (see his blog).

longdescription.p: To avoid that the missing of one of the devs makes difficult maintaining the project, all the technical documentation about Gentoo/*BSD must be written and published.

task.name: No GNU extensions
task.description: Make sure that GNU extensions are not used by portage

longdescription.p: Many ebuilds used to use GNU extensions to commands and other syntaxes that are not usable on BSD-like systems.
What we need to do is make sure that all the GNU-isms are avoided, using just a common set of POSIX options that are available on other systems.

milestone.description: Avoid usage of /bin/false as shell for enewuser
Avoid usage of GNUisms in cp options (like -d and -a)
Avoid usage of root:root in chowns

reference.bug: ebuilds should not use GNU specific cp options like -a or -d
chown root:root will be ignored on Gentoo/FreeBSD (and Gentoo/Darwin)

body.p: Other ways to contact Gentoo/*BSD developers include our IRC Channel #gentoo-bsd on Freenode, as well as the mailing list gentoo-bsd@gentoo.org. To subscribe just send an empty email to gentoo-bsd-subscribe@gentoo.org and follow the instructions included in the reply.
